xmlMandatorySingleRootNode.warning: This file is auto-generated. Edits to this file will be lost!
xmlMandatorySingleRootNode.description: The top-level object for a Device.
Root data model version, e.g. 2.4. For a vendor-defined root data model, this is the standard Broadband Forum model on which the vendor defined model is based. Possible patters: 2\.\d+
The number of entries in the InterfaceStack table.
This object has child objects which contain defines for individual applications.
This objects contains config parameters for the BCM msgd (BDK message router).
BCM uLog Level for this app. Enumeration of: "Error" "Notice" "Debug"
Bitmask of where the BCM uLog message go (1=Std Error, 2=Syslog)
This objects contains config parameters for the omcid app.
CMS Logging Level for this app. Enumeration of: "Error" "Notice" "Debug"
Where does the CMS log message go. Enumeration of: "Standard Error" "Syslog"
This objects contains config parameters for the gpon_md app.
BCM uLog Level for this app. Enumeration of: "Error" "Notice" "Debug"
Bitmask of where the BCM uLog message go (1=Std Error, 2=Syslog)
This objects contains config parameters for the GPON HAL thread (part of gpon_md app).
BCM uLog Level for the GPON HAL thread (part of the gpon_md app) Enumeration of: "Error" "Notice" "Debug"
Bitmask of where the BCM uLog message go (1=Std Error, 2=Syslog)
This object is a root of all OMCI related objects.
This object is a root of all OMCI run time data objects.
This object holds multicast runtime data.
IGMP admission flag.
This attribute limits the maximum rate of upstream IGMP traffic.
Blank delimited list of multicast interfaces which can be IGMP multicast sources.
Blank delimited list of bridge interface that have snooping enabled.
This object is a root of all layer 3 run time data objects.
Refer G.988 Section 9.4.1.
This object is a root of OMCI application debuggging objects.
This object is a root of the configuration related to the OMCI process.
This object holds the configurable system information of the OMCI Stack. The definition must be aligned with the corresponding definition in OMCISDK.
Maximum number of DS queues in the ONU. (1 byte).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the first TCONT managed entity. (2 bytes).
Maximum number of TCONT in the ONU. (1 byte).
0 - Init queue when the queue is used by a GEM port. 1 - Init queues when the T-CONT is set.
Number of schedulers between PQ and T-CONT (0, 1, 2).
Array of 32 16-bit integers; element per T-CONT.
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the first Ethernet managed entity. (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the second Ethernet managed entity. (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the third Ethernet managed entity. (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the fourth Ethernet managed entity. (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the fifth Ethernet managed entity. (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the sixth Ethernet managed entity. (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the seventh Ethernet managed entity. (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the eighth Ethernet managed entity. (2 bytes).
Flexible ME id mode for Ethernet UNI ports.
Default slot ID for 10/100 BASE-T Ethernet UNI ports. (1 byte).
Default slot ID for 10/100/1000 BASE-T Ethernet UNI ports. (1 byte).
Default slot ID for 10G Ethernet UNI portis. (1 byte).
Maximum number of Ethernet UNI ports (including both 10/100/1000 BASE-T and 10G) in the ONU. (1 byte).
The bit mask specifies which Ethernet port is member of RG bridge only, or ONT bridge only. (4 bytes).
Run PPTP ETH UNI_0 as VEIP. (4 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the first MoCA managed entity. (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the second MoCA managed entity. (2 bytes).
Maximum number of MoCA in the ONU. (1 byte).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the first POTS managed entity. (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the second POTS managed entity. (2 bytes).
Maximum number of POTS in the ONU. (1 byte).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the first Virtual Ethernet Interface Point (VEIP) managed entity. (2 bytes).
Maximum number of Virtual Ethernet Interface Point (VEIP) in the ONU. (1 byte).
Maximum number of downstream queues per device in the ONU. (1 byte).
The debug flags contains enable/disable information to specify which modules should display debug messages. (4 bytes).
The promisc mode that OMCI uses to configure the ONU. These modes are: 0 - off, 1 - on. (1 byte).
The mode that OMCI uses to get performance monitoring counters. These modes are: 0 - 15 minutes, 1 - current. (1 byte).
The true value indicates OMCI raw messages are accepted by HTTPD, otherwise OMCI raw messages are discarded by HTTPD.
Indicates the configuration is GPON RG FULL.
Indicates the configuration is GPON ONU.
This attribute identifies the traffic management option defined in ONU-G ME. (1 byte).
This attribute selects the voice provisioning model in G.988, OMCI path (0), or IP path (1). (1 byte).
This attribute identifies the OMCI application type, (0)G.984, (1)G.987. (1 byte).
This attribute identifies the PON interface type, (237)XG-PON10G2488, (238)XG-PON10G10, (248)GPON24881244. (1 byte).
This attribute identifies the QoS action when the downtream priority queue in GemPortNetworkCtp ME is unknown. (1 byte).
Indicates join request forwarding option. False - based on OMCI "unauthorized join request behaviour" attribute, True - override and force forwarding.
Configures the forwarding of frames with reserved destination MAC addresses.

An experimental flag, it defines how the ONU looks up the OMCI MIB to find the valid ANI-UNI paths. False - check the whole OMCI MIB, True - check the UNI ports that MEs on their ANI-UNI path have been updated.

Defines whether or not to enable the default VLANCtl rule configuration related to Extended VLAN ME. 0: disable in both US and DS directions; 1: enable in US direction only, 2: enable in DS direction only. 3: enable in both US and DS directions.
Defines pre-shared secret for Enhanced security control ME.
Defines whether or not to enable extended message set.
Defines ONU2-G ME OMCC version in G.988, default value 0 selects internal version.
Defines T-CONT allocId init value. (2 bytes).
Defines logical ONU ID.
Defines logical password.
Number of XTM UNI ports to be represented as PPTP ETH UNI or VEIP in the OMCI MIB. (1 byte).

It defines whether to use the 802.1p Mapper ME information when configuring the downstream VLAN filtering rule. The default value is false (802.1p Mapper not used), as G.988 states "downstream traffic arriving on any of the IEEE 802.1p mapper's GEM ports is directed to the mapper's root TP".
Multicast Host Control mode. When enabled, the ONU uses OMCI-provisioned multicast group entries without the need for an IGMP/MLD join.
Defines the Extended VLAN downstream mode local setting. 0xFF: follow the OLT configuration, otherwise - use the locally configured value.
Defines the name of the default LAN-side bridge owned by the Gateway domain, possible names are "br0", "br-lan", "br-lan0", etc.
The bit mask specifies whether an Ethernet LAN port is owned and has been taken by OMCI. (4 bytes).
Defines the Extended VLAN Received frame VLAN tagging operation table sorting mode. 0x0: follow the OLT configuration, 0x1: literally sort on the first 8 bytes.
This object holds the statistics counters of the OMCI Stack.
Total number of received packets.
Total number of received baseline packets.
Total number of received Extended packets.
Total number of length errors in received packets.
Total number of CRC errors in received packets.
Total number of errors other than length and CRC in received packets.
Total number of Attribute Value Change packets transmitted.
Total number of alarm packets transmitted.
Total number of Response packets transmitted.
Total number of Retransmissions.
Total number of transmission errors.
This object is a root of all GPON related objects.
This table models PON physical media. The table has just one entry if PON protection is not used.

Valid values are locks (1) and unlocks (0). When set to locks (1), it should disable all subscriber services on all ports of all circuit packs, and suppress all alarms, as well as powering down as much as possible.
Physical media interface status.
Specifies the hardware layout for the optical module, BOSA on board or external SFP.
Specifies the vendor name of the optical module.
Specifies the model name of the optical module.
Specifies the hardware version of the optical module.
Specifies the firmware version of the optical module.
Specifies the fiber connector used by the optical module.
Specifies the current redundancy state of the optical interface.
Specifies the downstream nominal data rate reachable depending the PON mode, expressed in kbps.
Specifies the upstream nominal data rate reachable depending the PON mode, expressed in kbps.
Specifies OMCI-configured performance monitoring thresholds.
Signal fail (SF) threshold. Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.1.
Signal degrade (SD) threshold. Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.1.
Specifies optical signal level received and thresholds.
Specifies optical signal level received, expressed in 0.1dBm.
Specifies the optical level the device uses to declare the low received optical power alarm, expressed in 0.1dBm.
Specifies the optical level the device uses to declare the high received optical power alarm, expressed in 0.1dBm.
Specifies optical signal level transmitted and thresholds.
Specifies optical signal level transmitted, expressed in 0.1dBm.
Specifies the optical level the device uses to declare the low transmitted optical power alarm, expressed in 0.1dBm.
Specifies the optical level the device uses to declare the high transmitted optical power alarm, expressed in 0.1dBm.
Specifies voltage related parameters.
Specifies the voltage supplied to the optical module, expressed in mV.
Specifies current related parameters.
Specifies the current bias applied to the SOA to pump laser, expressed in uA.
Specifies temperature related parameters.
Specifies the transceiver temperature, expressed in 0.1C.
Specifies TC layer alarms.
Rogue ONU indication.

This table models GTC layer statistics. Reference: ITU-T G.988, 9.2.9 "Forward error correction performance monitoring history data", 9.2.22 "Enhanced FEC performance monitoring history data", 9.2.15 "XG-PON TC performance monitoring history data". The table has just one entry if PON protection is not used.
Number of bytes that were corrected by the FEC function.
The code words that were corrected by the FEC function.
Errored code words that could not be corrected by the FEC function.
The total received code words.
HEC errors detected in the XGTC header. Reference: 'FS HEC error count' defined in Table C.14.1 of ITU-T G.9807. ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.15 and 9.2.23.
HEC errors in any of the fields of the downstream physical sync block. Reference: 'PSBd HEC error count' defined in Table C.14.1 of ITU-T G.9807. ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.15 and 9.2.23.
The number of instances of an XGEM frame HEC error. Reference: 'Count of XGEM frame header HEC errors' in Table C.14.1 of ITU-T G.9807. ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.15 and 9.2.23.
The number of 4 byte words lost because of an XGEM frame HEC error. Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.15 and 9.2.23.
PLOAM related status and statistics.
ONU-ID assigned by the OLT.
The vendor of the ONU.
The serial number of the ONU.
The ONU registration state.
The number of times the ONU pass through O5 between reboots.
The number of PLOAM messages transmitted upstream.
The number of PLOAM messages received downstream.
Counter of received PLOAM messages with MIC errors.
TC layer registration timers.
TO1 timer expressed in ms.
TO2 timer expressed in ms.
OMCI statistics.
The counter of baseline OMCI messages received by the ONU.
The counter of extended OMCI messages received by the ONU.
MIC errors detected in OMCI messages directed to this ONU.
This object models TC layer status.
TC layer ONU-ID identifier.
TC layer ONU serial number.
This object models the WAN link status at both TC layer and OMCI layer.
The WAN link name, e.g., "veip0".
The current operational state of the PON link. Reference: BBF TR-181, Device.Optical.Interface.

Up: the ONU has been provisioned at OMCI level for the VEIP interface, and it is ready to pass the data traffic. Down: the ONU is not provisioned at OMCI level for the VEIP interface, or it is not ready to pass the data traffic.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.5.5.
Linux interface name associated with this VEIP interface.
VEIP interface administrative state. Note in G.988, the values are 0 (unlock) and 1 (lock); in this data model, the values are string type "Lock/Unlock". Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.5.5.
VEIP interface operational state. Note this is different from the "Operational state" attribute defined in ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.5.5.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.5.5.
Specifies the traffic flow on VEIP.
Specifies the traffic flow on VEIP, ingress from the ONU perspective.
Number of VLAN tags in the flow.
Specifies the Q-VLAN object.
The VLAN ID of the Q-tag.
The Pbits (PCP field) of the Q-tag.
The Drop Eligible Indicator (DEI) field of the Q-tag.
Specifies the traffic flow on VEIP, egress from the ONU perspective.
Number of VLAN tags in the flow.
Specifies the Q-VLAN object.
The VLAN ID of the Q-tag.
The Pbits (PCP field) of the Q-tag.
The Drop Eligible Indicator (DEI) field of the Q-tag.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.12.16.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.12.16.
Reference: 'ACS network address', ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.12.16.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.12.16.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.12.16.
The VEIP interface name, e.g., "veip0".
Indicate the direction of the counters, upstream or downstream.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.

Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.3.34.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.13.
GEM port traffic type, Unidirectional or Bidirectional.
Alloc-Id associated with the GEM port, 0xFFFF if not applicable.
GEM port type, unicast, multicast, or broadcast.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.13.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.13.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.13.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.13.
Reference: ITU-T G.988, Clause 9.2.13.
Specifies the traffic flow on GEM.
Specifies the traffic flow on GEM, ingress from the ONU perspective.
Number of VLAN tags in the flow.
Specifies the C-VLAN object.
The VLAN ID of the C-tag.
The Pbits (PCP field) of the C-tag.
The Drop Eligible Indicator (DEI) field of the C-tag.
Specifies the S-VLAN object.
The VLAN ID of the S-tag.
The Pbits (PCP field) of the S-tag.
The Drop Eligible Indicator (DEI) field of the S-tag.
Specifies the traffic flow on GEM, egress from the ONU perspective.
Number of VLAN tags in the flow.
Specifies the C-VLAN object.
The VLAN ID of the C-tag.
The Pbits (PCP field) of the C-tag.
The Drop Eligible Indicator (DEI) field of the C-tag.
Specifies the S-VLAN object.
The VLAN ID of the S-tag.
The Pbits (PCP field) of the S-tag.
